s0141.chinese: 秦王初并天下，令丞相、御史曰：「異日韓王納地效璽，請為藩臣，已而倍約，與趙、魏合從畔秦，故興兵誅之，虜其王。
s0141.literal: When the King of Qin first unified all under Heaven, he ordered the prime minister and Imperial Secretary: "In the past, the King of Han surrendered territory and presented his seals, requesting to be a vassal state, but then broke the agreement and joined with Zhao and Wei in a vertical alliance to rebel against Qin; therefore we raised troops to punish him and captured their king.
s0141.idiomatic: When the King of Qin first unified all under Heaven, he ordered the prime minister and Imperial Secretary: "In the past, the King of Han surrendered territory and presented his seals, requesting to be a vassal state, but then broke the agreement and joined with Zhao and Wei in a vertical alliance to rebel against Qin; therefore we raised troops to punish him and captured their king.

s0142.chinese: 寡人以為善，庶幾息兵革。
s0142.literal: I considered this good, hoping to end military campaigns.
s0142.idiomatic: I considered this good, hoping to end military campaigns.

s0143.chinese: 趙王使其相李牧來約盟，故歸其質子。
s0143.literal: The King of Zhao sent his prime minister Li Mu to make a treaty, so we returned their hostage.
s0143.idiomatic: The King of Zhao sent his prime minister Li Mu to make a treaty, so we returned their hostage.

s0144.chinese: 已而倍盟，反我太原，故興兵誅之，得其王。
s0144.literal: But then they broke the treaty and took back our Taiyuan; therefore we raised troops to punish them and captured their king.
s0144.idiomatic: But then they broke the treaty and took back our Taiyuan; therefore we raised troops to punish them and captured their king.

s0145.chinese: 趙公子嘉乃自立為代王，故舉兵擊滅之。
s0145.literal: Prince Jia of Zhao then proclaimed himself King of Dai, so we raised troops to attack and destroy him.
s0145.idiomatic: Prince Jia of Zhao then proclaimed himself King of Dai, so we raised troops to attack and destroy him.

s0146.chinese: 魏王始約服入秦，已而與韓、趙謀襲秦，秦兵吏誅，遂破之。
s0146.literal: The King of Wei first agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to attack Qin; our officers and troops punished them and defeated them.
s0146.idiomatic: The King of Wei first agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to attack Qin; our officers and troops punished them and defeated them.

s0147.chinese: 荊王獻青陽以西，已而畔約，擊我南郡，故發兵誅，得其王，遂定其荊地。
s0147.literal: The King of Jing offered territory west of Qingyang, but then broke the agreement and attacked our Nan Commandery; therefore we mobilized troops to punish him, captured their king, and pacified their lands of Jing.
s0147.idiomatic: The King of Jing offered territory west of Qingyang, but then broke the agreement and attacked our Nan Commandery; therefore we mobilized troops to punish him, captured their king, and pacified their lands of Jing.

s0148.chinese: 燕王昏亂，其太子丹乃陰令荊軻為賊，兵吏誅，滅其國。
s0148.literal: The King of Yan was confused and chaotic; his crown prince Dan then secretly ordered Jing Ke to commit treachery; our officers and troops punished them and destroyed their state.
s0148.idiomatic: The King of Yan was confused and chaotic; his crown prince Dan then secretly ordered Jing Ke to commit treachery; our officers and troops punished them and destroyed their state.

s0149.chinese: 齊王用后勝計，絕秦使，欲為亂，兵吏誅，虜其王，平齊地。
s0149.literal: The King of Qi used Hou Sheng's plan, cut off Qin envoys, and intended to create disorder; our officers and troops punished them, captured their king, and pacified Qi's territory.
s0149.idiomatic: The King of Qi used Hou Sheng's plan, cut off Qin envoys, and intended to create disorder; our officers and troops punished them, captured their king, and pacified Qi's territory.

s0150.chinese: 寡人以眇眇之身，興兵誅暴亂，賴宗廟之靈，六王咸伏其辜，天下大定。
s0150.literal: I, with my humble person, raised troops to punish violent chaos, and relying on the spirits of the ancestral temples, the six kings all received their due punishment, and all under Heaven is greatly pacified.
s0150.idiomatic: I, with my humble person, raised troops to punish violent chaos, and relying on the spirits of the ancestral temples, the six kings all received their due punishment, and all under Heaven is greatly pacified.

s0151.chinese: 今名號不更，無以稱成功，傳後世。
s0151.literal: Now if the title and name are not changed, there will be no way to proclaim the accomplishment and transmit it to later generations.
s0151.idiomatic: Now if the title and name are not changed, there will be no way to proclaim the accomplishment and transmit it to later generations.

s0153.chinese: 丞相綰、御史大夫劫、廷尉斯等皆曰：「昔者五帝地方千里，其外侯服夷服諸侯或朝或否，天子不能制。
s0153.literal: Prime Minister Wan, Grand Censor Jie, Commandant of Justice Si and others all said: "In ancient times the Five Emperors' territory was a thousand li square; beyond it were the hou and yi service zones where feudal lords sometimes came to court and sometimes did not, and the Son of Heaven could not control them.
s0153.idiomatic: Prime Minister Wan, Grand Censor Jie, Commandant of Justice Si and others all said: "In ancient times the Five Emperors' territory was a thousand li square; beyond it were the hou and yi service zones where feudal lords sometimes came to court and sometimes did not, and the Son of Heaven could not control them.

s0154.chinese: 今陛下興義兵，誅殘賊，平定天下，海內為郡縣，法令由一統，自上古以來未嘗有，五帝所不及。
s0154.literal: Now Your Majesty has raised righteous troops, punished cruel rebels, pacified all under Heaven; all within the seas has become commanderies and counties, laws and decrees are unified under one authority; from high antiquity this has never occurred, beyond what the Five Emperors achieved.
s0154.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty has raised righteous troops, punished cruel rebels, pacified all under Heaven; all within the seas has become commanderies and counties, laws and decrees are unified under one authority; from high antiquity this has never occurred, beyond what the Five Emperors achieved.

s0155.chinese: 臣等謹與博士議曰：『古有天皇，有地皇，有泰皇，泰皇最貴。』
s0155.literal: We your ministers carefully deliberated with the scholars and said: 'In ancient times there was the Tianhuang, the Dihuang, and the Taihuang; the Taihuang was most noble.'
s0155.idiomatic: We your ministers carefully deliberated with the scholars and said: 'In ancient times there was the Tianhuang, the Dihuang, and the Taihuang; the Taihuang was most noble.'

s0156.chinese: 臣等昧死上尊號，王為『泰皇』。
s0156.literal: We your ministers at risk of death present the honored title: that the king be called 'Taihuang.'
s0156.idiomatic: We your ministers at risk of death present the honored title: that the king be called 'Taihuang.'

s0157.chinese: 命為『制』，令為『詔』，天子自稱曰『朕』。」
s0157.literal: Commands shall be called 'zhi,' decrees shall be called 'zhao,' and the Son of Heaven shall refer to himself as 'zhen.'"
s0157.idiomatic: Commands shall be called 'zhi,' decrees shall be called 'zhao,' and the Son of Heaven shall refer to himself as 'zhen.'"

s0158.chinese: 王曰：「去『泰』，著『皇』，采上古『帝』位號，號曰『皇帝』。
s0158.literal: The king said: "Remove 'Tai,' retain 'Huang,' and adopt the ancient title 'Di,' to be called 'Huangdi' (Emperor).
s0158.idiomatic: The king said: "Remove 'Tai,' retain 'Huang,' and adopt the ancient title 'Di,' to be called 'Huangdi' (Emperor).

s0159.literal: For other matters, proceed as discussed."
s0159.idiomatic: For other matters, proceed as discussed."
